Package hype

Class HDrawable

java.lang.Object
hype.HNode<HDrawable>
hype.HDrawable
All Implemented Interfaces:
HDirectable, HHittable, HLocatable, HRotatable, java.lang.Iterable<HDrawable>
Direct Known Subclasses:
HCanvas, HDrawable3D, HEllipse, HGroup, HImage, HPath, HRect, HShape, HSprite, HStage, HText
public abstract class HDrawable
extends HNode<HDrawable>
implements HDirectable, HHittable, java.lang.Iterable<HDrawable>
The superclass of all drawables. Drawables represent objects that are displayable to the stage. (The stage itself is also technically a drawable, but its usage is different from the other classes.)
Author:
james

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  HDrawable.HDrawableIterator
    An HIterator used for iterating through HDrawable's children.

  • Constructor Details

    • HDrawable

      public HDrawable()
      The default constructor for HDrawable. It sets several fields into their proper default values: - alpha percentage = 1 (100%) - fill = white - stroke = black - stroke cap = round - stroke join = miter - stroke weight = 1 - width = 100 - height = 100

  • Method Details

    • copyPropertiesFrom

      public void copyPropertiesFrom​(HDrawable other)
      Copies the values of `other`'s basic HDrawable fields. This method is primarily used for implementing createCopy(). It copies the following fields from `other`: - x & y coordinates - x & y anchors - width & height - rotation - alpha - stroke & fill properties
      Parameters:
      other - The drawable to copy its properties from.

    • createCopy

      public abstract HDrawable createCopy()
      Creates a copy of this drawable. This method is abstract and is meant to be implemented by the children of this class.
      Returns:
      A copy of this drawable.

      public HDrawable firstChild()

    • add

      public HDrawable add​(HDrawable child)
      Adds the passed drawable as this drawable's child. If `child` is already a child of another drawable, it removes itself from its current parent and gets added to this drawable. If `child` is already a child of this drawable, then it does nothing.
      Parameters:
      child - The child to be added to this drawable.
      Returns:
      The drawable passed through this method.

    • remove

      public HDrawable remove​(HDrawable child)
      Removes a child from this drawable. If `child` isn't a child of this drawable, this method will do nothing. Regardless, it will still return `child`.
      Parameters:
      child - The child to be removed from this drawable
      Returns:
      The drawable passed through this method.

    • iterator

      public HDrawable.HDrawableIterator iterator()
      Creates a new iterator for this drawable to iterate through its children. Note that while HIterator has similar functionalities with java.util.Iterator, the former does _not_ extend the latter. This is due to js mode compatibility issues.
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<HDrawable>
      Returns:
      A new HIterator for this drawable
      See Also:
      HDrawable.HDrawableIterator, HIterator

    • locAt

      public HDrawable locAt​(int where)
      Positions this drawable at the defined location in relation to its parent, or (0,0) if the parent is null. The `where` parameter can be any of the following HConstants values: - `HConstants.NONE` (does nothing) - `HConstants.LEFT` - `HConstants.RIGHT` - `HConstants.CENTER_X` - `HConstants.TOP` - `HConstants.BOTTOM` - `HConstants.CENTER_Y` - `HConstants.CENTER` - `HConstants.TOP_LEFT` - `HConstants.TOP_RIGHT` - `HConstants.BOTTOM_LEFT` - `HConstants.BOTTOM_RIGHT` - `HConstants.CENTER_LEFT` - `HConstants.CENTER_RIGHT` - `HConstants.CENTER_TOP` - `HConstants.CENTER_BOTTOM` These values can be combined via bitwise OR, so `H.TOP | H.LEFT` would be equal to `H.TOP_LEFT`.
      Parameters:
      where - The value that represents the location for this drawable.
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      anchorAt(int)

    • anchor

      public HDrawable anchor​(float pxX, float pxY)
      Sets the anchor of this drawable by pixels. Note that HDrawable stores its anchor coordinates as a percentage of its width and height. So if the current size of this drawable is `(100,100)`, setting the anchor to `(75,75)` will be stored as `(0.75,0.75)`. In case that the current width or height is 0, then the width or height is assumed to be 100 when computing the anchor in this method.
      Parameters:
      pxX - The desired x anchor for this drawable, in pixels.
      pxY - The desired y anchor for this drawable, in pixels.
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      anchor(processing.core.PVector), anchorX(float), anchorY(float)

    • anchor

      public HDrawable anchor​(processing.core.PVector pt)
      Sets the anchor of this drawable by pixels via a PVector. This method calls anchor(float,float) with `pt`'s x and y fields as the arguments.
      Parameters:
      pt - The PVector containing the desired x and y anchor for this drawable, in pixels
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      anchor(float,float)

    • anchor

      public processing.core.PVector anchor()
      Returns the anchor of this drawable in pixels. The result of this method is the product of its width & height and its x & y anchor percentages respectively. So if this drawable is anchored at the center, this method will return `(50,50)` when the size is `(100,100)`, `(30,30)` when the size is `(60,60)` and `(0,0)` when size is `(0,0)`.
      Returns:
      A new PVector containing the anchor of this drawable, in pixels.
      See Also:
      anchorX(), anchorY()

    • anchorX

      public HDrawable anchorX​(float pxX)
      Sets the x anchor of this drawable by pixels. Note that HDrawable stores its x anchor coordinates as a percentage of its width. If the width of this drawable is 0, it is assumed as 100 when computing the x anchor in this method.
      Parameters:
      pxX - The desired x anchor for this drawable, in pixels.
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      anchor(float,float), anchor(processing.core.PVector), anchorY(float)

    • anchorX

      public float anchorX()
      Returns the x anchor of this drawable in pixels. The result of this method is the product of its width and x anchor percentage.
      Returns:
      The x anchor of this drawable, in pixels.
      See Also:
      anchor(), anchorY()

    • anchorY

      public HDrawable anchorY​(float pxY)
      Sets the y anchor of this drawable by pixels. Note that HDrawable stores its y anchor coordinates as a percentage of its height. If the height of this drawable is 0, it is assumed as 100 when computing the y anchor in this method
      Parameters:
      pxY - The desired y anchor for this drawable, in pixels.
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      anchor(float,float), anchor(processing.core.PVector), anchorX(float)

    • anchorY

      public float anchorY()
      Returns the y anchor of this drawable in pixels. The result of this method is the product of its height and y anchor percentage.
      Returns:
      The y anchor of this drawable, in pixels.
      See Also:
      anchor(), anchorX()

    • anchorUV

      public HDrawable anchorUV​(float u, float v)
      Sets the anchor of this drawable in UV coordinates.
      Parameters:
      u - The desired `u` coordinate for this drawable's anchor.
      v - The desired `v` coordinate for this drawable's anchor.
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      anchorU(float), anchorV(float)

    • anchorAt

      public HDrawable anchorAt​(int where)
      Sets the anchor of this drawable at the defined location in relation to itself. The `where` parameter can be any of the following HConstants values: - `HConstants.NONE` (does nothing) - `HConstants.LEFT` - `HConstants.RIGHT` - `HConstants.CENTER_X` - `HConstants.TOP` - `HConstants.BOTTOM` - `HConstants.CENTER_Y` - `HConstants.CENTER` - `HConstants.TOP_LEFT` - `HConstants.TOP_RIGHT` - `HConstants.BOTTOM_LEFT` - `HConstants.BOTTOM_RIGHT` - `HConstants.CENTER_LEFT` - `HConstants.CENTER_RIGHT` - `HConstants.CENTER_TOP` - `HConstants.CENTER_BOTTOM` These values can be combined via bitwise OR, so `H.TOP | H.LEFT` would be equal to `H.TOP_LEFT`.
      Parameters:
      where - The value that represents the anchor for this drawable.
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      locAt(int)

    • size

      public HDrawable size​(float w, float h)
      Sets the size of this drawable. If this drawable is set to resize proportionally, the new width will be adjusted according to the new height by default. (The exception to this is if the new height is the same as the old height, then the new height will be adjusted according to the new width instead.)
      Parameters:
      w - The new width for this drawable.
      h - The new height for this drawable.
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      size(float), width(float), height(float)

    • size

      public HDrawable size​(float s)
      Sets the size of this drawable. This method delegates size(float,float).
      Parameters:
      s - The new width and height for this drawable.
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      size(float,float), width(float), height(float)

    • proportional

      public HDrawable proportional​(boolean b)
      Sets whether or not this drawable will be resized proportionally. If set to true, then this drawable will try to keep the width and height at the same ratio when you try to change either the width or height.
      Parameters:
      b - True, if this drawable will keep its size proportionally.
      Returns:
      This drawable.

    • fill

      public HDrawable fill​(int clr)
      Sets the fill for this drawable. This method takes in a standard Processing color integer, which are commonly represented as `0xAARRGGBB` or `#RRGGBB`.
      Parameters:
      clr - The new fill for this drawable.
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      fill(int,int), fill(int,int,int), fill(int,int,int,int)

    • fill

      public HDrawable fill​(int clr, int alpha)
      Sets the fill for this drawable. The `clr` parameter is a standard Processing color integer and alpha is any number from 0 to 255. Note that `alpha` would override the existing alpha value of `clr`. So if `clr` is `0x80FFFFFF` and `alpha` is `0x40`, the fill will become `0x40FFFFFF`.
      Parameters:
      clr - The new fill for this drawable, excluding its alpha value.
      alpha - The alpha for the new fill for this drawable.
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      fill(int), fill(int,int,int), fill(int,int,int,int), noFill()

    • fill

      public HDrawable fill​(int r, int g, int b)
      Sets the fill for this drawable. The parameters `r`, `g` and `b` can be any number from 0 to 255.
      Parameters:
      r - The red component for the new fill for this drawable
      g - The green component for the new fill for this drawable
      b - The blue component for the new fill for this drawable
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      fill(int), fill(int,int), fill(int,int,int,int), noFill()

    • fill

      public HDrawable fill​(int r, int g, int b, int a)
      Sets the fill for this drawable. The parameters `r`, `g`, `b` and `a` can be any number from 0 to 255.
      Parameters:
      r - The red component for the new fill for this drawable
      g - The green component for the new fill for this drawable
      b - The blue component for the new fill for this drawable
      a - The alpha component for the new fill for this drawable
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      fill(int), fill(int,int), fill(int,int,int), noFill()

      public int fill()
      Returns the fill for this drawable. The color returned by this method is a standard Processing color integer.
      Returns:
      The fill of this drawable.

    • noFill

      public HDrawable noFill()
      Removes the fill of this drawable. Technically, this method sets the fill to HConstants.CLEAR, which is `0x00FFFFFF` or fully transparent white.
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      fill(int), fill(int,int), fill(int,int,int), fill(int,int,int,int)

    • alpha

      public HDrawable alpha​(int a)
      Sets the transparency for this drawable. The argument for this method can be any number from 0 to 255. Otherwise, if the argument is less than 0, the alpha will be 0; and if the argument is greater than 255, the alpha will be 255. Note that transparency _is independent from fill and stroke color_, even if the fill and stroke can also have alpha values. And unlike fill and stroke, this transparency can be passed down to this drawable's children. Also note that HDrawable actually stores `alpha` as a percentage ranging from 0 to 1 to keep the draw() and paintAll() methods a bit faster.
      Parameters:
      a - The new alpha for this drawable.
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      alphaPc(float)

    • alpha

      public int alpha()
      Returns the transparency for this drawable, ranging at `[0,255]`. You can be assured that the return value will only be in the aforementioned range.
      Returns:
      The alpha for this drawable with range `(0,255)`.
      See Also:
      alphaPc()

    • alphaPc

      public HDrawable alphaPc​(float f)
      Sets the transparency for this drawable, as percentage. The argument for this method can be any number from 0 to 1. Otherwise, if the argument is less than 0f, the alpha will be 0f; and if the argument is greater than 1f, the alpha will be 1f.
      Parameters:
      f - The new alpha for this drawable, as percentage.
      Returns:
      This drawable.
      See Also:
      alphaPc(float)

    • alphaPc

      public float alphaPc()
      Returns the transparency for this drawable, ranging from 0 to 255. You can be assured that the return value will only be in the aforementioned range.
      Returns:
      The alpha for this drawable with range `(0f,1f)`.
      See Also:
      alpha()

    • visibility

      public HDrawable visibility​(boolean v)
      Sets the visibility of this drawable. Technically this method manipulates the alpha of this drawable. If `v` is false, the alpha will become the negative of the current alpha, making this drawable invisible. Otherwise, if `v` is true, the alpha will become the positive of the current alpha (or 1f if the current alpha is 0), making this drawable visible.
      Parameters:
      v - True if this drawable will be visible, false if invisible.
      Returns:
      This drawable.

    • visibility

      public boolean visibility()
      Returns the visibility of this drawable.
      Returns:
      True if this drawable is visible, otherwise false.

    • show

      public HDrawable show()
      Makes this drawable visible by calling `visibility(true)`.
      Returns:
      This drawable.

    • hide

      public HDrawable hide()
      Makes this drawable invisible by calling `visibility(false)`.
      Returns:
      This drawable.

    • paintAll

      public void paintAll​(processing.core.PGraphics g, boolean usesZ, float currAlphaPc)
      Prepares the environment for drawing this drawable and its children. This method is primarily called internally during the draw cycle and probably wouldn't need to be called directly.
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics context for this drawable.
      usesZ - Indicates if z-coordinates are used.
      currAlphaPc - The current alpha value in the draw cycle.

    • draw

      public abstract void draw​(processing.core.PGraphics g, boolean usesZ, float drawX, float drawY, float currAlphaPc)
      Draws this drawable. This method is abstract and is meant to be implemented by the children of this class. Also, this method is primarily called internally during the draw cycle and probably wouldn't need to be called directly.
      Parameters:
      g - The graphics context for this drawable.
      usesZ - Indicates if z-coordinates are used.
      drawX - The x coordinate where this drawable would consider as 0
      drawY - The y coordinate where this drawable would consider as 0
      currAlphaPc - The current alpha value in the draw cycle.
